user_input: Please create hourly Methane demand profiles for the TYNDP 2026 Scenarios. Use the 'NT', 'NT_HE' and 'NT_LE' Scenarios. Use the year 2030, 2035, 2040 and 2050. Split the nodes. Convert to tst format. No need to access any PLEXOS database for now
author: Dante
default_llm_context: Perform the specified operations based on the user's input and the Terajoule Model specifications, working only with external data/files and not interacting with any PLEXOS database.

function_args.user_input: Generate hourly Methane demand profiles for TYNDP 2026 scenarios: NT, NT_HE, NT_LE; years: 2030, 2035, 2040, 2050. Requirements: hourly granularity; node_splitting=true; do not access any PLEXOS database; save outputs as intermediate demand profile files for subsequent TST export; record assumptions and output locations.

tasks.description: Generate hourly Methane demand profiles for TYNDP 2026 scenarios 'NT', 'NT_HE', and 'NT_LE' for years 2030, 2035, 2040, and 2050 with node splitting enabled. Work strictly off files (no PLEXOS DB access) and persist intermediate outputs for downstream TST conversion.
tasks.entity_selection_context: Based on the user's request: '{user_input}', select or create appropriate non-DB input sources and determine output file paths for generated hourly profiles. Ensure node splitting is applied and outputs are organized by scenario and year.

tasks.description: Convert the generated hourly Methane demand profiles into TST-format workbooks for the TYNDP study team for scenarios 'NT', 'NT_HE', 'NT_LE' and years 2030, 2035, 2040, and 2050. Operate only on files produced by the previous task; no PLEXOS DB access.
tasks.entity_selection_context: Use the full outputs from the dependency 'main_demand_processer_v2' to identify input profile files and determine TST workbook destinations. Adhere to standard TST conventions and naming.
